A ggplot-based violin plot wrapper function

ggViolin.Rd

A ggplot-based violin plot wrapper function

ggViolin(x = NULL, y = NULL, xlabel = NULL, ylabel = NULL,
  xOrder = NULL, addPoints = FALSE, size = 1, baseSize = 6,
  ratioYX = NULL, sampleRatio = 0.1, title = "",
  pal = paletteDiscrete(values = x, set = "stallion"), ...)

Arguments

x

A character vector containing the categorical x-axis values for each y-axis value.
y

A numeric vector containing the y-axis values for each point.
xlabel

The label to plot for the x-axis.
ylabel

The label to plot for the y-axis.
xOrder

A character vector indicating a custom order for plotting x-axis categorical values for plotting. Should contain all possible values of x in the desired order.
addPoints

A boolean value indicating whether individual points should be added to the plot using geom_quasirandom.
size

The line width for boxplot lines.
baseSize

The base font size to use in the plot.
ratioYX

The aspect ratio of the x and y axes on the plot.
sampleRatio

sampling ratio for number of dots to be shown from original data over violins to prevent over-crowding. Default is set to 0.1.
title

The title of the plot.
pal

A custom palette for discrete coloring.

Contents

  • Arguments

Developed by Jeffrey Granja, Ryan Corces.
